meanings.definition: Not able to be read or deciphered.
meanings.sent1: The writing on the old, torn paper was completely unreadable.
meanings.sent2: The smudged ink made the note unreadable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read the faded text on the ancient scroll was like deciphering an ancient code - completely unreadable!
meanings.sent4: The professor's handwriting was so messy that his notes were practically unreadable.
meanings.sent5: The blurry text on the screen was so unreadable that even with glasses, I couldn't make out a single word.

meanings.definition: Difficult or impossible to read due to poor handwriting or print quality.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant menu had such tiny print that it was almost unreadable.
meanings.sent2: The smudged letters on the envelope made the address unreadable.
meanings.sent3: The jumbled letters on the sign made it look like a secret code - completely unreadable!
meanings.sent4: The faded print on the old book made the text nearly unreadable.
meanings.sent5: The poorly printed document was so unreadable that I had to ask for a new copy.
